citation.article-title: Shinella yambaruensis sp. nov., a 3-methyl-sulfolane-assimilating bacterium isolated from soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Shinella yambaruensis sp. nov.
Shinella yambaruensis (yam.ba.ru.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. yambaruensis referring to the Yambaru area of Okinawa Prefecture, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile, oval to short rods, 1.0–1.2×1.6–2.1 μm.
Spore formation is not observed.
Does not show finger-like or amorphous flocculation in liquid culture.
Catalase-, oxidase- and β-glucosidase-positive.
No β-galactosidase is produced.
Strictly aerobic.
Growth occurs at 15–42 °C and pH 4–9.
Freshwater species, but able to grow in the presence of 2 % NaCl.
l-Arabinose can support growth.
Can assimilate sulfolane or 3-methyl sulfolane as sole sulfur source.

Cells oxidize the following substrates: glycerol, erythritol, l-arabinose, ribose, d-xylose, adonitol, galactose, glucose, fructose, mannose, rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, N-acetylglucosamine, arbutin, aesculin, cellobiose, maltose, sucrose, trehalose, xylitol, gentiobiose, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol and l-arabitol.

d-Arabinose, l-xylose, methyl β-d-xyloside, sorbose, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, amygdalin, salicin, lactose, melibiose, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, starch, glycogen, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate and 5-ketogluconate are not assimilated.
The major fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 0 and C19 : 1.
The hydroxy fatty acids C16 : 0 3-OH and C14 : 0 3-OH are also detected as trace components.
Starch and gelatin are not hydrolysed.
The main quinone is Q-10.
The type strain is MS4T (=NBRC 102122T=DSM 18801T), isolated from soil from the Ryukyu Archipelago, Japan.
The genomic G+C content of the type strain is 66.4 mol%.
